    cards1 cards2 goal result
    [‚Äúi‚Äù, ‚Äúdrink‚Äù, ‚Äúwater‚Äù] [‚Äúwant‚Äù, ‚Äúto‚Äù] [‚Äúi‚Äù, ‚Äúwant‚Äù, ‚Äúto‚Äù, ‚Äúdrink‚Äù, ‚Äúwater‚Äù] ‚ÄúYes‚Äù
    [‚Äúi‚Äù, ‚Äúwater‚Äù, ‚Äúdrink‚Äù] [‚Äúwant‚Äù, ‚Äúto‚Äù] [‚Äúi‚Äù, ‚Äúwant‚Äù, ‚Äúto‚Äù, ‚Äúdrink‚Äù, ‚Äúwater‚Äù] ‚ÄúNo‚Äù

    ÎÇòÏùò ÌíÄÏù¥

    import Foundation

func solution(_ cards1:[String], _ cards2:[String], _ goal:[String]) -> String {
    var cd1 = cards1
    var cd2 = cards2
    var removeCnt: Int = 0
    
    for i in goal {
        if cd1.count != 0 && i == cd1[0] {
            cd1.remove(at: 0)
            removeCnt += 1
        } else if cd2.count != 0 && i == cd2[0] {
            cd2.remove(at: 0)
            removeCnt += 1
        }
    }
    
    if goal.count == removeCnt {
        return "Yes"
    } else {
        return "No"
    }
}

    Îã§Î•∏ ÏÇ¨Îûå ÌíÄÏù¥

    import Foundation

func solution(_ cards1:[String], _ cards2:[String], _ goal:[String]) -> String {
    var reverseCards1 = Array(cards1.reversed())
    var reverseCards2 = Array(cards2.reversed())

    for g in goal {
        if !reverseCards1.isEmpty && reverseCards1.last == g {
            reverseCards1.removeLast()
            continue
        }
        if !reverseCards2.isEmpty && reverseCards2.last == g {
            reverseCards2.removeLast()
            continue
        }
        return "No"
    }
    return "Yes"
}
